intro: Vernonia leucodendron, commonly known as the white coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Vernonia leucodendron is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
